nodes.bodyText:
We don't remove vanilla fields. That's a major binary break, and wouldn't be wanted even if we weren't in the no-breaking-changes stage.
I believe that alone makes this PR in the current state a no-go.
EDIT: oops! I misread the change. it's not removing a field, it's just removing a final. This should be in an AT, not patch. My comment about what I think the right solution would be still stands, though.
This is now outdated, since the field isn't definalized anymore
There is no reason to move the bracket onto a new line. (patches are supposed to be as "simple" as possible)

This is just ugly, Just have
 private static final RegisteryObject<SoundEvent> TEST_SOUND = ... 
 private static final RegistryObject<Item> TEST_DISC = ...

At the top
Data generators would be nice for all the jsons
Should I create a new data provider for this situation in this PR or should I open up a new one with the specified addition?
Make a new PR for the added data gen.
Better to just reuse a vanilla sound so we don't have to deal with having other people's licenses and data in our repo.
